html.p: Provide capability for customers to filter event log channels based on standard fields in the event payload like Event Code, Task Category, Level , etc. This allows customers to target specific event entries that are of highest value to them while filtering out lower value events; thereby taking full advantage of their indexing volume.
Below is a sample stanza showing configuration in inputs.conf with two whitelist regexes highlighted -

pre.code: [WinEventLog://Security] disabled=0 whitelist1= EventCode=/^[4|5].*$/ Type=/Error|Warning/ whitelist2= TaskCategory=%^Log.*$%

html.p: The above configuration will result in the ingestion of Windows security event logs that match the following criteria:

ul.li: Events with EventCode that starts with the numbers 4 or 5 AND have type set to Error or Warning
Events with TaskCategory that begin with “Log”.

html.p: Additional notes: Upto to 10 whitelist and 10 blacklist configuration can be specified for a given stanza. Blacklist override whitelist when conflicts occur. The regex terms for multiple criteria within a given whitelist/blacklist are treated as logical AND. The set of whitelists / blacklists are then logically OR to come up with the effective set that will apply to the stanza.
